channel.title: A 'Staff of ?' does not give unlimited runes
channel.description:
[size=14pt][font=arial]So for example the 'Staff of Fire' should give unlimited fire runes when equipped. But it does not, even though it displays for the 'Fire Bolt' spell */4. It still does not work.
Here is what I mean.[/font][/size]
[size=14pt][url=http://imgur.com/qdVeV9W]http://imgur.com/qdVeV9W[/url]
[url=http://imgur.com/S09sRFn]http://imgur.com/S09sRFn[/url] [url=http://imgur.com/8ABYeNl]http://imgur.com/8ABYeNl[/url][/size]
[size=14pt][font=arial]Can somebody please explain a fix to this problem please? :)
Thank you, Krajix[/font][/size]

item.title: A 'Staff of ?' does not give unlimited runes
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

That would be because i did not give you the id’s for the staves? your server, your work :o

Read full topic
item.source: A 'Staff of ?' does not give unlimited runes

item.title: A 'Staff of ?' does not give unlimited runes
item.dc:creator: @Krajix Krajix
item.description:
@Krajix wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:13, topic:542646”]yes it should be. and My code is not exactly what you need. But it has the general idea for you. Basically you convert if (PLAYER_HAS_THESE_RUNES) to if (PLAYER_HAS_THESE_RUNES or RELATED_STAFF_EQUIPPED)
your best bet would be to write/find a method for
public boolean hasFireRunes(int count)
Then add the cases in there for if they have a staff return true.
Use that method for all FireRune required spell calls, and create them for other runes as well.
Do not use the code i gave you as i even saw a typo in it. Just use it as an idea for what you need.
Think through your problem fully before trying to make a solution, Make your code as useable as possible - so it requires less modification in the future. In an ideal world, all code would have more than one purpose.
But think about the future:
if you add a custom staff to the game - what would be required in order to change the methods to allow its special rune(s)?

In current code, you would have to have an exception for each kind of staff in each method that required that type of rune.
if you were to put that logic into a boolean method, you shortened your source, make it more morphic friendly(ability to be changed in the future) and made your work required greatly reduced.

[code]public boolean hasFireRunes(int numRunes) {
    for (int id : new int[]{FIRE_STAFF,FIRE_BATTLESTAFF,ELEMENTAL_STAFF(new revision), STEAM_STAFF, LAVA_STAFF})
        if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == id)
            return true;

    return player.hasItem(554/*FIRE RUNE ID*/,numRunes);

}[/code]
notice i condenced 6 conditions into one method call.[/quote]

This method does not look like it fits anywhere in my Client.java

Read full topic
item.source: A 'Staff of ?' does not give unlimited runes

item.title: A 'Staff of ?' does not give unlimited runes
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

yes it should be. and My code is not exactly what you need. But it has the general idea for you. Basically you convert if (PLAYER_HAS_THESE_RUNES) to if (PLAYER_HAS_THESE_RUNES or RELATED_STAFF_EQUIPPED)
your best bet would be to write/find a method for
public boolean hasFireRunes(int count)
Then add the cases in there for if they have a staff return true.
Use that method for all FireRune required spell calls, and create them for other runes as well.
Do not use the code i gave you as i even saw a typo in it. Just use it as an idea for what you need.
Think through your problem fully before trying to make a solution, Make your code as useable as possible - so it requires less modification in the future. In an ideal world, all code would have more than one purpose.
But think about the future:
if you add a custom staff to the game - what would be required in order to change the methods to allow its special rune(s)?

In current code, you would have to have an exception for each kind of staff in each method that required that type of rune.
if you were to put that logic into a boolean method, you shortened your source, make it more morphic friendly(ability to be changed in the future) and made your work required greatly reduced.

[code]public boolean hasFireRunes(int numRunes) {
    for (int id : new int[]{FIRE_STAFF,FIRE_BATTLESTAFF,ELEMENTAL_STAFF(new revision), STEAM_STAFF, LAVA_STAFF})
        if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == id)
            return true;

    return player.hasItem(554/*FIRE RUNE ID*/,numRunes);

}[/code]
notice i condenced 6 conditions into one method call.

Read full topic
item.source: A 'Staff of ?' does not give unlimited runes

item.title: A 'Staff of ?' does not give unlimited runes
item.dc:creator: @Krajix Krajix
item.description:
@Krajix wrote:

the 'ifCastspell version of 1183 please?
I do not have an 'ifCastspell version of 1183' it is not in 'client.java' or 'magicSpells.cfg'
if (player.hasItem(554/*fire rune*/,n/*amount*/ || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == FIRE_STAFF)
Is this for delta 317? and if so, would it be added to 'Client.java' somewhere?

Read full topic

item.title: A 'Staff of ?' does not give unlimited runes
item.dc:creator: @Krajix Krajix
item.description:
@Krajix wrote:

well, you could try and cast the spell without runes. and then you'll probably get a sendmessage. post that sendmessage with the code here please.

or you could search for the spellID for the spell. then post the code and ill help you out

SendMessage without runes:

if(castSpell == 1178) //High Alch with staffs and Fire runes (BY soul) { if(playerLevel[6] >= 55) { if((HasItemAmount(561, 1)==false) || (HasItemAmount(554, 5)==false) && playerEquipment[playerWeapon] != 1387 || (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1387) && (HasItemAmount(561, 1)==false)) { sM("You do not have enough runes to cast this spell."); } if((HasItemAmount(561, 1)==true) && (HasItemAmount(554, 5)==true) || (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1387) && (HasItemAmount(561, 1)==true)) {

Spell ID in ‘magicSpells.cfg’

entire ‘magicSpells.cfg’

[code]//
// magicSpells.cfg
//
// ===================================
// Copyright© Mr. Brightsite 2007
// ===================================
//
// ===================================
// NOTE:
// You may edit these numbers
// if you wish.
//
// ===================================
//
// =========================================
// Uses First:
// This defines wether the spell
// uses a launch gfx, like modern.
// Need to use this because ancient
// spells don’t use a launch graphic.
// ----
// 1 = Yes
// 0 = No
// ----
//
// ========
// MODERN
// ========
//------ID------emote–gfx----usesFirst-lvl----rune1–rune1am–rune2—rune2am–rune3–rune3am–rune4–rune4am-item—hitdiff–XP-----projH.–EndH.----SpellName
spell = 1152 711 90 1 1 558 1 556 1 -1 0 -1 0 -1 2 300 43 100 Wind_Strike
spell = 1153 1165 108 1 3 555 3 557 2 559 1 -1 0 -1 200 40 43 100 Confuse
spell = 1154 711 93 1 5 555 1 556 1 558 1 -1 0 -1 4 330 43 100 Water_Strike

spell = 1157 1164 105 1 11 555 3 557 2 559 1 -1 0 -1 300 60 43 100 Weaken
spell = 1158 711 99 1 13 554 3 556 2 558 1 -1 0 -1 8 400 43 100 Fire_Strike
spell = 1160 711 117 1 17 556 2 562 1 -1 0 -1 0 -1 9 500 43 100 Air_Bolt
spell = 1161 1163 102 1 19 555 2 557 3 559 1 -1 0 -1 300 80 43 100 Curse
spell = 1163 711 120 1 23 555 2 556 2 562 1 -1 0 -1 11 530 43 100 Water_Bolt
spell = 1572 710 177 1 20 557 3 555 3 561 2 -1 0 -1 0 300 43 100 Bind

spell = 1175 711 135 1 47 555 3 556 3 560 1 -1 0 -1 14 730 43 100 Water_Blast
spell = 1539 708 87 1 50 554 5 560 1 -1 0 -1 0 1409 25 1000 43 100 Iban_Blast
spell = 1582 710 177 1 50 557 4 555 4 561 2 -1 0 -1 5 600 43 100 Snare
spell = 12037 1576 327 1 50 560 1 558 4 -1 0 -1 0 4170 19 600 43 100 Magic_Dart
spell = 1177 711 138 1 53 556 3 557 4 560 1 -1 0 -1 15 760 43 100 Earth_Blast
spell = 1181 711 129 1 59 556 4 554 5 560 1 -1 0 -1 16 800 43 100 Fire_Blast

spell = 1189 1167 155 1 75 556 5 565 1 554 7 -1 0 -1 20 1200 43 100 Fire_Wave
spell = 1592 710 177 1 79 557 5 555 5 561 4 -1 0 -1 5 320 43 100 Entangle
spell = 12445 1819 343 1 85 563 1 562 1 560 1 -1 0 -1 0 60 43 100 Teleblock
// =========
// ANCIENT
// =========
//------ID------emote–gfx----usesFirst-lvl----rune1–rune1am–rune2—rune2am–rune3–rune3am–rune4–rune4am-item—hitdiff–XP-----projH.–EndH.----SpellName
